newsitem.title: INDIA: India's United Breweries to invest $29.85 million.
newsitem.headline: India's United Breweries to invest $29.85 million.

text.p: Indian liquor-major, United Breweries (UB) will invest $29.85 million in 1996/97 in its overseas operations, its chairman said on Monday.
This includes $18 million in African and Eastern (Near East) Ltd, a UK registered wholly owned subsidiary of Unilever Plc in the Gulf to take over distribution of liquor business.

"We will offset our losses in the country due to prohibition (liquor ban) in some (Indian) states by going global to consolidate our market shares," Vijay Mallya told reporters after UB's annual general meeting in the southern city of Bangalore.
UB is the holding company of India's $4.2 billion UB group.
The company plans to raise five billion rupees for expansion of the group's international operations. "We are planning to go for an international issue to raise the funds," Mallya said.
He said the company would also invest 30 million rupees in its joint venture with Danish brewer Carlsberg.
UB officials said the company recorded a net profit of 273.3 million rupees in the 18-month period ended 1995/96 April-March) against 271.8 million in the previous 18-month period.
